availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Michael Fitzpatrick (Louisville, Kentucky, hotel keeper and grocer)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, hotel keeper and grocer. Native of Ireland. Married to Eliza Moone Fitzpatrick in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on August 16, 1858. Father of George W. Fitzpatrick, Dennis T. Fitzpatrick, and Richard Fitzpatrick. Immigrated to the United States on July 12, 1850. Porter in Louisville in 1858. Student in Louisville in 1860. Steward at the United States Hotel in Louisville in 1860. Steward at the United States Hotel in Louisville in 1861. Hotel keeper in Louisville in 1864. Grocer in partnership with Timothy Leahy in Louisville in 1865.
